author: Patsy Montesinos
title: Nonprofit aims to transform legacy into community hub
text:
Men 2 Be, an organization focused on uplifting young boys to reach their fullest potential, needs your help. They have taken on the significant task of restoring a dilapidated building to serve the entire community.
‚ÄúAttucks is a beacon light,‚Äù said alumna Teresa Moss. ‚ÄúWe should continue to let that light shine.‚Äù
Named after the Black man who was the first American to die in the Revolutionary War, Crispus Attucks High School was a safe place for students like Moss during segregation.
‚ÄúThey taught us from the ground up,‚Äù explained Moss. ‚ÄúThey taught us to be mannerable. They taught us to have dignity. They taught us to speak well.‚Äù
Opened in 1916, Crispus Attucks High School was the first and only Black high school in the area. In the 1960s, it became an integrated middle school until it closed its doors in 1988. Moss says that now, more than ever, preserving this history is important.
‚ÄúAttucks is a historical site, and many historical sites like Attucks are being destroyed or eliminated,‚Äù added Moss.
That‚Äôs why the alumni association gifted the building to Men 2 Be last year for one dollar. Since 2020, they‚Äôve mentored hundreds of young boys, empowering them to chase their dreams.
‚ÄúWe teach everyday life skills,‚Äù explained Men 2 Be co-founder LaDessa Lewis. ‚ÄúWe teach them how to be productive citizens in the community.‚Äù
They are raising one million dollars to transform the building into a center that offers support to those in need.
‚ÄúA place where people can get resources, a place where people can have recreation, a place for even residential support for our seniors in the community,‚Äù added Lewis.
They dream of creating a space that uplifts not only the Black community but everyone in the area.
‚ÄúThat's what it's about. It's about love and helping,‚Äù said alumna Arnethia Stepp.
A benefit concert is scheduled for Saturday, April 26th, at 5 p.m. at the Bridge of Hope Fellowship.
Pictures in our story from the high school were from the
Museums of Historic Hopkinsville-Christian County.
Do you have more information about this story? You can email me at Patsy.Montesinos@NewsChannel5.com.
The line ''see something, say something" took on new meaning recently in Bowling Green. Two alert neighbors helped tip police to stolen Corvettes from the nearby assembly plant. That led law enforcement to find 8 stolen Corvettes worth over $1 million. We may all be able to learn a little lesson from this.
-Lelan Statom

author: ExpressDigest
title: Crystal Palace believe they can appoint ex-Nottingham Forest boss Steve Cooper WITHOUT paying compensation as Roy Hodgson faces the axe after dismal run‚Ä¶ but the Welshman could seek a break from football
text:
- Crystal Palace are considering replacing Roy Hodgson with Steve Cooper
- Officials believe they would not have to pay compensation to old side Forest
- Chris Sutton and Ian Ladyman give their best sporting moments of the year on It‚Äôs All Kicking Off
Crystal Palace believe they are clear to appoint Steve Cooper without paying compensation to Nottingham Forest amid growing uncertainty over Roy Hodgson‚Äôs position.
However, Palace could face difficulty convincing Cooper to make a quick return to management following his City Ground departure last week, with sources indicating the Welshman is minded to take a short break from football.
Hodgson‚Äôs role is under scrutiny after eight games without a win, and tomorrow‚Äôs match against Brentford is crucial for his prospects. Defeat could prove the final straw for Palace chiefs.
Mail Sport understands there is already a feeling among members of the club‚Äôs hierarchy that a change is needed. Others are reluctant to part ways with the highly-respected boss before the summer.
Cooper‚Äôs sacking at Forest last week has become a factor as Palace contemplate their next move. The former Swansea manager is admired at Palace and has long been viewed as a potential successor to 76-year-old Hodgson.
Crystal Palace believe they are clear to appoint ex-Forest boss Steve Cooper without paying compensation
Palace chiefs ‚Äì led by chairman Steve Parish (R) ‚Äì feel that a change may be needed after eight games without a win under Roy Hodgson (L)
Your browser does not support iframes.
It is understood Cooper is not subject to a period of gardening leave by Forest, meaning he can be appointed by his next club without a compensation fee.
Palace chiefs had hoped Hodgson would see out the season before the club appointed a younger manager to implement a new approach. But Cooper‚Äôs availability, coupled with the team‚Äôs poor form, may force Palace into accelerating their vision, though that will depend on whether the 44-year-old is open to returning to work.
Ipswich boss Kieran McKenna also features on Palace‚Äôs list of candidates to replace Hodgson, while assistant manager Paddy McCarthy has impressed as part of the backroom team and could be elevated to the top job on a short-term basis.
If Palace lose to Brentford in their next game it will only pile the pressure on Hodgson
IT‚ÄôS ALL KICKING OFF!
It‚Äôs All Kicking Off is an exciting new podcast from Mail Sport that promises a different take on Premier League football, with a show every Monday and Thursday this season.
It is available on MailOnline, Mail+, YouTube , Apple Music and Spotify

title: El miedo se apodera de los vecinos afectados por el incendio de Tarragona: "Cre√≠a que no iba a salir de ah√≠"
text: El incendio en Tarragona evoluciona de forma favorable y permite levantar las restricciones de movilidad en casi todos los municipios afectados. Son 18.000 personas las que tuvieron que estar confinadas mientras ve√≠an entrar las llamas a sus casas. Uno de ellos fue Ricard, quien fue testigo de c√≥mo el fuego rozaba su mas√≠a. En ella, estaba toda una vida con su padre y su hermana. ‚ÄúEs la casa donde me he criado. Ver que lo pierdes todo te entra en la cabeza‚Äù, confiesa.

author: Luis Alvaro Rodriguez Barrera
title: Fuertes vientos y lluvias azotan a Bogot√°, as√≠ volaron las tejas de un colegio distrital | Vanguardia.com
text: En la tarde de este jueves, 21 de marzo, se presentaron varias emergencias en Bogot√° por cuenta de los fuertes vientos y lluvias. Las lluvias y fuertes vientos que se presentaron en la tarde de este jueves, 21 de marzo, en Bogot√°, ocasionaron m√∫ltiples estragos. Una de las principales im√°genes de las emergencias fue captada en el colegio distrital Estanislao Zuleta en el sur de la capital. En un video difundido en redes sociales se aprecia el momento en el que las fuertes brisas se llevan varias tejas de la instituci√≥n mencionada. Lea tambi√©n: [‚ÄúDej√≥ perder un bill√≥n y medio de pesos que iba para las universidades‚Äù: Presidente Petro a su exministro Alejandro](https://www.vanguardia.com/colombia/2024/03/21/dejo-perder-un-billon-y-medio-de-pesos-que-iba-para-las-universidades-presidente-petro-a-su-exministro-alejandro-gaviria/) Gaviria ‚ÄúUribe no nos est√° pagando el impuesto predial‚Äù: Presidente Petro lanz√≥ pullas al expresidente [M√°s Podcast](https://www.vanguardia.com/podcast) Por el momento, las autoridades de gesti√≥n de riesgo no reportan personas lesionadas por cuenta de la emergencia. Sin embargo, se espera un balance oficial. Sin embargo, este no fue el √∫nico sitio de la ciudad en el que se presentaron desprendimientos en la infraestructura, pues en algunas viviendas de la localidad de Usme, los techos fueron arrancados por el paso de los vientos. Seg√∫n el reporte del Instituto Distrital de Gesti√≥n de Riesgos y Cambio Clim√°tico , Idiger, las zonas en las que hubo mayor intensidad en las lluvias fueron las localidades de Rafael Uribe Uribe, San Crist√≥bal, Antonio Nari√±o, La Candelaria, Santa Fe, Usaqu√©n y Suba. ‚Äî IDIGER (@IDIGER) [#AEstaHora]Se intensifican las lluvias sobre las localidades de Rafael Uribe Uribe, San Crist√≥bal, Antonio Nari√±o, La Candelaria, Santa Fe, Usaqu√©n y Suba. Se prev√© se extiendan al resto de la ciudad en los pr√≥ximos minutos üå®Ô∏è [pic.twitter.com/vjHTFrdki2] [March 21, 2024] En otro de los puntos de la capital en donde se presentaron estragos fue en la localidad de Suba, m√°s exactamente en la Calle 139 con Carrera 127C. En ese sitio, un √°rbol cay√≥ sobre la v√≠a, lo que impidi√≥ el paso de veh√≠culos. [04:22 p.m.]‚Äî Bogot√° Tr√°nsito (@BogotaTransito) [#GerenciaEnV√≠a]informa | Se presenta novedad vial en la localidad de Suba, por ca√≠da de √°rbol en la calle 139 con carrera 127C. Se asigna unidad de [@BomberosBogota]üöí [pic.twitter.com/hOk4quAhPW] [March 21, 2024]

author: VNExplorer
title: Monsalve contradice a Juan Andr√©s Lagos y afirma que le comunic√≥ personalmente la decisi√≥n de removerlo de Interior
text: El subsecretario del Interior, Manuel Monsalve, se refiri√≥ la tarde de este jueves a la controversia por desvinculaci√≥n del asesor Juan Andr√©s Lagos (PC). Desde La Moneda, la autoridad de gobierno se√±al√≥: ‚ÄúEn materia laboral tengo una pr√°ctica m√°s all√° del rol que me corresponde hoy d√≠a como subsecretario del Interior: Todas las personas que dependen directamente de m√≠, siempre hablo con ellas previo a contratarlas. Y si en alg√∫n momento considero necesario terminar esa relaci√≥n laboral, siempre hablo con ellos previo a terminar esa relaci√≥n. No hay excepci√≥n al respecto, ninguna‚Äù. ‚ÄúUno no cuestiona esas decisiones‚Äù: Toh√° responde por remoci√≥n de Juan Andr√©s Lagos de Interior tras cr√≠ticas del PC Paulina Vodanovic respalda decisi√≥n de Monsalve por la salida de Juan Andr√©s Lagos y llama a los partidos a terminar con la p√≥lemica Monsalve sostuvo que ‚Äúdurante estos d√≠as se han producido varios cambios al interior de la Subsecretar√≠a del Interior. Uno a nivel de asesores, dos a nivel de jefe de divisi√≥n‚Äù. ‚ÄúSon cargos que dependen directamente de m√≠. Y por tanto, con todas esas personas antes de contratarlas siempre habl√© (con ellas) y antes de que se termine el contrato siempre habl√© con todas ellas‚Äù, expres√≥. 27/06/2024 MANUEL MONSALVE, SUBSECRETARIO DEL INTERIOR MARIO TELLEZ / LA TERCERA En cuanto a las razones para remover a la figura del Partido Comunista del cargo de asesor de la subsecretar√≠a, dijo: ‚ÄúLas decisiones tienen un solo fin. Los roles que cumple la subsecretar√≠a del Interior son extraordinariamente relevantes para el pa√≠s. Y todas las decisiones que toman las subsecretarias del Interior son pensando en cumplir las funciones del gobierno‚Äù. Y luego agreg√≥: ‚ÄúCumplir bien esas funciones, porque para el pa√≠s son extraordinariamente importantes. Siempre las razones van a ser esas, no hay ninguna otra raz√≥n‚Äù. Previo a estas declaraciones de Monsalve, en privado en La Moneda aseguraban que el martes Lagos visit√≥ el palacio presidencial -algo que no hac√≠a todos los d√≠as por su condici√≥n de contratado a honorarios- y tuvo una conversaci√≥n con el subsecretario, en la que hab√≠a otros asesores, en que se zanj√≥ su salida. La narrativa de Palacio y del subsecretario difiere de los dichos del ahora exasesor y tambi√©n de la c√∫pula del PC representada por su presidente Lautaro Carmona. Esta ma√±ana, Lagos se refiri√≥ por primera vez a su remoci√≥n en di√°logo con Radio Nuevo Mundo y relat√≥ los d√≠as previos. ‚ÄúPara ser estrictamente riguroso, yo en las semanas pasadas tuve intercambio, a prop√≥sito de esta presi√≥n que se gener√≥ y se ven√≠a generando desde la derecha‚Äù, parti√≥ se√±alando. Juan Andr√©s Lagos. Foto: Javier Salvo/Aton Chile. Incluso, agreg√≥, ‚Äúah√≠ se hizo todo un procedimiento de trabajo para que toda esta presi√≥n no da√±ara el trabajo de la Subsecretar√≠a en particular‚Äù. ‚ÄúPero a m√≠ nunca se me dijo que estaba ad portas de una situaci√≥n que iba a concluir con mi salida. Eso no se me dijo‚Äù, afirm√≥. Carmona, en tanto, en un punto de prensa desde la sede de la colectividad -flanqueado por el propio Lagos- asegur√≥ que no estaba al tanto de la decisi√≥n y que se enter√≥ de la noticia por la prensa, es decir, tras la publicaci√≥n de La Tercera de este mi√©rcoles. Es m√°s, el timonel elev√≥ el tono e indic√≥ que ‚Äúen estas 24 horas todav√≠a no tengo ninguna explicaci√≥n. Insisto, no es obligaci√≥n, es solo si uno quiere. Una explicaci√≥n al que est√° a cargo del PC, que es la condici√≥n de la militancia de Juan Andr√©s Lagos, y que de eso se hizo todo un debate p√∫blico, particularmente de parte de la derecha, exigiendo incluso la salida por su condici√≥n de comunista‚Äù. Figueroa reitera cr√≠ticas del PC por remoci√≥n de Juan Andr√©s Lagos de Interior y apunta a falta de ‚Äúcortes√≠a‚Äù del gobierno Carmona afirma que tras salida de Lagos no ha recibido ‚Äúninguna explicaci√≥n‚Äù y acusa campa√±a para descalificar al exasesor por su militancia

author: Asian News International
title: ‚ÄòGovt raising Hijab issue to cover up its failures‚Äô: Bommai
text: Bengaluru: As the hijab controversy flares up in Karnataka, former Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai accused current CM Siddaramaiah of hiding the failures of his government as well as raising the issue for only political gains. He told reporters here on Saturday that the Hijab was not banned all over the state but not allowed where there was a dress code. Muslim women are permitted to wear the hijab everywhere. ‚ÄúWhen the Hijab is not banned where is the question of lifting the ban,‚Äù he questioned. ‚ÄúAs per the comprehensive education policy, the school uniform policy came into being but it was brought into effect by the previous government. Siddaramaiah has spoken about the withdrawal of the Hijab ban order when the case was still pending in the Supreme Court. The issue has been raised only for political gains which would be condemned in the strongest words,‚Äù Bommai said. Sparking a series of discussions, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah announced in a public meeting that his government will lift the ban on hijab imposed by the previous BJP government in the state. ‚ÄúWe are thinking of withdrawing the decision (of hijab ban). We will discuss it. I have said this in response to a question. We have not done it yet,‚Äù the Chief Minister added. CM Siddaramaiah said in his speech that no politics should be done on what people prefer to wear and eat. ‚ÄúThere was a drought in the state, and the women didn‚Äôt have protection. The government was so bankrupt that it had stopped making the children clean toilets. To cover up all these failures, the Congress leaders were making such statements to mislead people. They did the same thing when the IT raid on a contractor yielded crores of rupees. The incumbent government was not at all interested in development. The government has a sinister design of creating a rift among the kids,‚Äù he added. Bommai said the Hijab issue was being discussed at the international level and the women in Iran and Iraq have launched a struggle seeking freedom against the Hijab. What was the need for the CM to make a statement on the row when the apex court was seized of the matter? ‚ÄúI am confident that the court will take note of the same,‚Äù he asserted.
